page.title: 05ECOLOGY:WOODTON AREA
page.content: The relatively dry climate makes this a cereal farming area,consequently the associated huge machinery has meant over 50% of the hedges & ditches have gone,creating C20 "open-field" system. However,our farmers are increasingly aware of the need to retain wild-life habitats,& the remaining hedges are often managed with conservation in mind.More careful post-harvest straw-burning is now less likely to damage habitats,but creates pollution; charred particles infiltrating houses. The area is boulder-clay,but with a belt of sand & gravel under part of Woodton.The verge flora therefore inc- ludes cream-coloured clover,burnet saxifrage,primroses,cowslips, bedstraws & tansy. There are only 2 registered footpaths & 1 bridleway,but green lanes make leisure walking a possible pleasure.
